content: bebe kitty sweater welcome to the bebe kitty sweater this sweater uses 2x2 ribbing to make it stretchy the fabric is form-fitting but gentle so that it is both comfortable for the cat and doesn t fall 0ff please enjoy -michelle materials aran or worsted-weight yarn 4 5 mm circular needles or dpns stitch markers darning needle scissors abbreviations co cast on bobble bind off st stitch kntbl knit n stitches through the back loop k knit pm place marker sm slip marker rm remove marker round round ssk slip slip knit k2tog knit two together rb work stitches as presented in order to continue ribbing increase increase by knitting into the front and back of a stitch pattern instructions to begin using main color co 76 on 6 5mm needles using a stretchy cast on join in the round and pm to mark beg of row work in k2p2 ribbing until the piece measures approx 3 in making the back strip you should be started at the beginning of a round in one round rb 8 pm rb 22 pm rb 16 pm rb 22 pm rb 8 sm rm sl 8 sts rb 22 rm turn continue working ribbing back and forth on these 22 sts this is knitted in the flat while the rest of the piece is held on the wire knit until the flat part of the piece reaches approx 4 in from the round part cut yarn leaving a long tail and leave sts on a holder making the front strip starting working back and forth in the flat in ribbing on the 22 sts opposite to the back strip work until the piece is approx 3 5 in from the round part then work the following row note any increases should be made so that the stitch fits into the ribbing pattern for example if the increase is being made at the beginning of the row and the first two stitches on the row are purls then the increase should create a knit stitch row 1 increase 1 rb to last st increase 1 row 2 rb repeat row 1 and 2 5 more times at the end there should be 34 sts next we ll be making the neck by joining the front and back in the round so continue on to the next section without cutting the yarn making the neck rb across all 34 sts of front strip then rb across the 22 sts on the back strip continue onto the front strip again so that the front and back strips are joined work ribbing in the round until the neck measures approx 2 5 in this creates the standard neck if you want a turtleneck continue ribbing until the neck is approx 4 in bobble with a stretchy bind-off and cut yarn leaving a long enough tail to weave in making the arms rb across the sts held at the bottom of one of the armholes there should be
